intro: Glochidion brachystylum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved globemallow, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
